conclusion: Analyze forces on rods and induced current in circuit formed by rods and magnetic field.
Force on each rod due to magnetic field is \( F_B = BIL \).
Current \( I \) can be found using power dissipated in resistors.
Total power dissipated in resistors is \( P_{\text{total}} = I^2 (2R) \).
Work done by force \( F \) is \( W_F = F \cdot d \).
Work done by magnetic force is negative of change in magnetic potential energy.
Magnetic potential energy is \( U = \frac{1}{2} B^2 L^2 v_a t \).
Total work done equals change in total mechanical energy of system.
Set up equations to solve for velocity of rod \( b \).
Power supplied by force \( F \) is \( P_F = F \cdot v_a \).
Power lost to magnetic force is \( P_B = I^2 (2R) \).
Power supplied by force equals power lost to magnetic force plus other work.
Calculate current using power dissipated: \( P_{\text{total}} = I^2 (2R) \).
Find time \( t \) using \( Q = I^2 R t \).
Solve \( 0.12 = I^2 \cdot 0.1 \cdot t \) to find \( t = \frac{1.2}{I^2} \).
Determine velocity of rod \( b \) using work-energy principles.
Velocity of rod \( b \) is \( v_b = 2.0 \mathrm{m/s} \).
